gremlin.server.hosts.description: The list of hosts that the driver will connect to. Default = localhost. Ex: '192.168.0.12,node2,node3'

gremlin.server.port.description: The port of the Gremlin Server to connect to. The same port will be applied for all hosts. Default = 8182

gremlin.server.username.description: The username to submit on requests that require authentication. Default = none

gremlin.server.password.description: TThe password to submit on requests that require authentication. Default = none

gremlin.server.jaasEntry.description: Sets the AuthProperties.Property.JAAS_ENTRY properties for authentication to Gremlin Server. Default = none

gremlin.server.protocol.description: Sets the AuthProperties.Property.PROTOCOL properties for authentication to Gremlin Server. Default = none

gremlin.server.nioPoolSize.description: Size of the pool for handling request/response operations. Default = available processors

gremlin.server.workerPoolSize.description: Size of the pool for handling background work. Default = available processors * 2

gremlin.server.serializer.className.description: The fully qualified class name of the MessageSerializer that will be used to communicate with the server. Note that the serializer configured on the client should be supported by the server configuration. Default = none

gremlin.server.connectionPool.channelize.description: The fully qualified classname of the client Channelizer that defines how to connect to the server. Default = org.apache.tinkerpop.gremlin.driver.Channelizer$WebSocketChannelizer

gremlin.server.connectionPool.enableSsl.description: Determines if SSL should be enabled or not. If enabled on the server then it must be enabled on the client. Default = false

gremlin.server.connectionPool.keepAliveI.description: Length of time in milliseconds to wait on an idle connection before sending a keep-alive request. Set to zero to disable this feature. Default = 1800000

gremlin.server.connectionPool.keyCertCha.description: The X.509 certificate chain file in PEM format. Default = none

gremlin.server.connectionPool.keyFile.description: The PKCS#8 private key file in PEM format. Default = none

gremlin.server.connectionPool.keyPasswor.description: The password of the keyFile if it is password-protected. Default = none

gremlin.server.connectionPool.maxContent.description: The maximum length in bytes that a message can be sent to the server. This number can be no greater than the setting of the same name in the server configuration. Default = 65536

gremlin.server.connectionPool.maxInProce.description: The maximum number of in-flight requests that can occur on a connection. Default = 4

gremlin.server.connectionPool.maxSimulta.description: The maximum number of times that a connection can be borrowed from the pool simultaneously. Default = 16

gremlin.server.connectionPool.maxSize.description: The maximum size of a connection pool for a host. Default = 8

gremlin.server.connectionPool.maxWaitFor.description: The amount of time in milliseconds to wait for a new connection before timing out. Default = 3000
The amount of time in milliseconds to wait for a session to close before timing out (does not apply to sessionless connections). Default = 3000

gremlin.server.connectionPool.minInProce.description: The minimum number of in-flight requests that can occur on a connection. Default = 1

gremlin.server.connectionPool.minSimulta.description: The maximum number of times that a connection can be borrowed from the pool simultaneously. Default = 8

gremlin.server.connectionPool.minSize.description: The minimum size of a connection pool for a host. Default = 2

gremlin.server.connectionPool.reconnectI.description: The amount of time in milliseconds to wait before trying to reconnect to a dead host. Default = 1000

gremlin.server.connectionPool.resultIter.description: The override value for the size of the result batches to be returned from the server. Default = 64

gremlin.server.connectionPool.trustCertC.description: File location for a SSL Certificate Chain to use when SSL is enabled. If this value is not provided and SSL is enabled, the TrustManager will be established with a self-signed certificate which is NOT suitable for production purposes. Default = none
